document.heading: Blind Vendors Tax Relief Amendment Act of 1985

history.narrative: Law 6-89, the “Blind Vendors Tax Relief Amendment Act of 1985,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-132, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 19, 1985 and December 3, 1985, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 30, 1985, it was assigned Act No. 6-117 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
